name: Prune Users
author: Ryan McLaughlin

sections.description: This will allow administrators to prune out old users that have never contributed to the blog with either a comment or a post.
sections.installation:
1. Upload ‘prune-users.php’ to the ‘/wp-content/plugins/’ directory
  2. Activate the plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress
  3. Access the plugin in the Settings menu
sections.changelog:
1.0

  • Initial submission

= 1.1=
* Some minor changes to the GUI. This adds a box for the results so that long deletes will not fill up the screen. Also update the links on the page to reflect the actual URL for the plugin.

short_description: This will allow administrators to prune out old users that have never contributed to the blog with either a comment or a post.
description: This will allow administrators to prune out old users that have never contributed to the blog with either a comment or a post.

upgrade_notice.1.1: • No new functionality, just a couple GUI tweaks (see Changelog). Upgrade if that is important to you.
